concept.title: Working With Image Files
concept.shortdesc:
Images launched with the Grabit image editor are displayed at the centre of the canvas area if the image is smaller than editor area. Otherwise, it is displayed with scroll bars to enable panning.
The Grabit tool has a basic selection of tools which can be used to add lines, shapes and texts to images. This section provides information on their usage.

section.title: Editing Images
section.p:
The editing tools available in Grabit can be accessed from the toolbar. These tools are:
Freehand drawing - Can be used for drawing freeform lines.
Straight line - for drawing straight lines.
Rectangle tool - for drawing a rectangular shapes.
Square tool - for drawing squares.
Oval tool - for drawing oval shapes.
Circle tool - for drawing circle shapes.
All the above tools have line and fill properties that can be set to suit individual needs. Properties of a selected tool are visible in the property panel at the bottom of the drawing area. The line size, style and colour can be changed as well as the fill colour.

The other tools in the toolbar are:
Text tool - for adding text to images
Crop tool - for cropping the image
Zoom tools - for zooming in and out.
SVG export tool - for exporting to svg.
The above tools will be discussed in a little more detail.

section.title: Adding text to image
section.p: Using the text tool is easy. Select the text tool then click on the drawing area and start typing in the text field. When the 'Enter' is pressed, the text would be written on the image using the font style in the property panel. A desired font type, size and colour can be set using the property panel. Texts can also be set to bold, italic and underline.

section.title: Cropping
section.p: To enable cropping, first click the crop tool then move to a desired point within the drawing area. Clicking and holding the mouse button while moving the mouse over the desired crop area would draw a rectangle over the image. The image would become cropped when the mouse button is released.

section.title: Zooming
section.p: The zoom icons in the grabit sidebar can be used to zoom in/out of an image. Alternatively, holding down the CTRL (or command key) whilst pressing – or + keys would also zoom out or in on the displayed image. Using the zoom-in icon, users can zoom-in to a specific point, the zoom to point is more accurate when the screen image is not smaller the drawing area.

section.title: Exporting Images to SVG Editor
section.p: The SVG tool () allows Grabit to embed an image in an svg file. Clicking the SVG tool will prompt the user for a filename to be used. Once created the svg file will be launched by Beermat (or your default SVG editor). This action will cause your image to be saved. If the image is an unsaved screen grab, you will be prompted twice (first, to save the image. Secondly, to provide a filename for the svg file.)

section.title: Saving Images
section.p: Saving an image in a format different from the source image’s format can be done by clicking the SaveAs in the file menu option and simply set the extension to the desired format (any of .bmp, .gif, .png, .jpg, .jpeg, ico. and .tiff).
